title: Contributor Covenant 3.0 Code of Conduct
text: Tensions can occur community members even trying best collaborate. every conflict represents code conduct violation, Code Conduct reinforces encouraged behaviors norms can help avoid conflicts minimize harm. incident occur, important report promptly. report possible violation, please send email danielvartan@proton.description incident. Community Moderators take reports violations seriously make every effort respond timely manner. investigate reports code conduct violations, reviewing messages, logs, recordings, interviewing witnesses participants. Community Moderators keep investigation enforcement actions transparent possible prioritizing safety confidentiality. order honor values, enforcement actions carried private involved parties, communicating whole community may part mutually agreed upon resolution.

title: Contributor Covenant 3.0 Code of Conduct
text: investigation Community Moderators finds Code Conduct violated, following enforcement ladder may used determine best repair harm, based incident’s impact individuals involved community whole. Depending severity violation, lower rungs ladder may skipped. Event: violation involving single incident series incidents. Consequence: private, written warning Community Moderators. Repair: Examples repair include private written apology, acknowledgement responsibility, seeking clarification expectations. Event: repeated incidence violation previously resulted warning, first incidence serious violation. Consequence: private, written warning time-limited cooldown period designed underscore seriousness situation give community members involved time process incident. cooldown period may limited particular communication channels interactions particular community members. Repair: Examples repair may include making apology, using cooldown period reflect actions impact, thoughtful re-entering community spaces period . Event: pattern repeated violation Community Moderators tried address warnings, single serious violation. Consequence: private written warning conditions return suspension. general, temporary suspensions give person suspended time reflect upon behavior possible corrective actions. Repair: Examples repair include respecting spirit suspension, meeting specified conditions return, thoughtful reintegrate community suspension lifted. Event: pattern repeated code conduct violations steps ladder failed resolve, violation serious Community Moderators determine way keep community safe person member. Consequence: Access community spaces, tools, communication channels removed. general, permanent bans rarely used, strong reasoning behind , resorted working remedies failed change behavior. Repair: possible repair cases severity. enforcement ladder intended guideline. limit ability Community Managers use discretion judgment, keeping best interests community.

title: Contributor Covenant 3.0 Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official email address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Daniel Vartanian. Author, maintainer, conceptor, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vartanian, D. (2025). lockr: Easily encrypt decrypt files [Computer software]. https://danielvartan.github.io/lockr/
code: @Misc{,   title = {lockr: Easily encrypt and decrypt files},   author = {Daniel Vartanian},   year = {2025},   url = {https://danielvartan.github.io/lockr/},   note = {Computer software}, }

title: Easily Encrypt and Decrypt Files
text: lockr simple user-friendly R package designed encrypting decrypting files.

title: Easily Encrypt and Decrypt Files
text: can install lockr using remotes package:

title: Easily Encrypt and Decrypt Files
text: lockr usage straightforward. main functions : lock_file: Encrypt file. unlock_file: Decrypt locked file. Along , helper functions facilitate key management tasks. Click see full list lockr functions.

title: Easily Encrypt and Decrypt Files
code: Copyright (C) 2025 Daniel Vartanian  lockr is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.  This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.  You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

title: Easily Encrypt and Decrypt Files
text: Contributions always welcome! Whether want report bugs, suggest new features, help improve code documentation, input makes difference. opening new issue, please check issues tab see topic already reported.

what: Encrypt or decrypt all files in a directory — lock_dir
title: Encrypt or decrypt all files in a directory — lock_dir
text: WARNING: Use function caution! Check parameters carefully. lock_dir() unlock_dir() encrypt decrypt files given directory using OpenSSL RSA key pair.

title: Encrypt or decrypt all files in a directory — lock_dir
code: lock_dir(   dir,   public_key = here::here("_ssh", "id_rsa.pub"),   suffix = ".lockr",   remove_file = TRUE )  unlock_dir(   dir,   private_key = here::here("_ssh", "id_rsa"),   suffix = ".lockr",   remove_file = TRUE,   password = NULL )

title: Encrypt or decrypt all files in a directory — lock_dir
text: dir character string indicating directory encrypt decrypt. public_key (optional) openssl RSA public key character string specifying public key path. See rsa_keygen() learn create RSA key pair (default: ::("_ssh", "id_rsa.pub")). suffix (optional) character string specifying suffix add encrypting remove decrypting. Must start . (default: ".lockr"). remove_file (optional) logical value indicating original file must removed encryption/decryption process (default: TRUE). private_key (optional) openssl RSA private key character string specifying private key path. See rsa_keygen() learn create RSA key pair (default: ::("_ssh", "id_rsa")). password (optional) character string specifying password decrypting protected private key. security, avoid hardcoding passwords scripts. Use askpass() prompt secure input (default: NULL).

title: Encrypt or decrypt all files in a directory — lock_dir
text: invisible NULL. functions called side effects .

title: Encrypt or decrypt all files in a directory — lock_dir
code: ## Locking files -----  ssh_dir <- tempfile("ssh") dir.create(ssh_dir)  rsa_keygen(ssh_dir) #> ℹ Keys successfully created at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/ssh19d841ffe827.  temp_dir <- tempfile("dir") dir.create(temp_dir)  for (i in seq_len(5)) file.create(tempfile(tmpdir = temp_dir))  list.files(temp_dir) #> [1] "file19d830987cd1" "file19d83ba086c3" "file19d849b88c4"  "file19d8504aed18" #> [5] "file19d86ae7f57f"  temp_dir |>   lock_dir(     public_key = file.path(ssh_dir, "id_rsa.pub")   ) #> ℹ Locked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d830987cd1.lockr. #> ℹ Locked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d83ba086c3.lockr. #> ℹ Locked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d849b88c4.lockr. #> ℹ Locked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d8504aed18.lockr. #> ℹ Locked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d86ae7f57f.lockr.  ## Unlocking files -----  temp_dir |>   unlock_dir(     private_key = file.path(ssh_dir, "id_rsa")   ) #> ℹ Unlocked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d830987cd1. #> ℹ Unlocked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d83ba086c3. #> ℹ Unlocked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d849b88c4. #> ℹ Unlocked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d8504aed18. #> ℹ Unlocked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d87cce470/file19d86ae7f57f.

what: Encrypt or decrypt single files — lock_file
title: Encrypt or decrypt single files — lock_file
text: lock_file() unlock_file encrypt decrypt kind file using OpenSSL RSA key pair.

title: Encrypt or decrypt single files — lock_file
code: lock_file(   file,   public_key = here::here("_ssh", "id_rsa.pub"),   suffix = ".lockr",   remove_file = TRUE )  unlock_file(   file,   private_key = here::here("_ssh", "id_rsa"),   suffix = ".lockr",   remove_file = TRUE,   password = NULL )

title: Encrypt or decrypt single files — lock_file
text: file character string file path encrypted/decrypted. security reasons, encrypted files must end suffix parameter. public_key (optional) openssl RSA public key character string specifying public key path. See rsa_keygen() learn create RSA key pair (default: ::("_ssh", "id_rsa.pub")). suffix (optional) character string specifying suffix add encrypting remove decrypting. Must start . (default: ".lockr"). remove_file (optional) logical value indicating original file must removed encryption/decryption process (default: TRUE). private_key (optional) openssl RSA private key character string specifying private key path. See rsa_keygen() learn create RSA key pair (default: ::("_ssh", "id_rsa")). password (optional) character string specifying password decrypting protected private key. security, avoid hardcoding passwords scripts. Use askpass() prompt secure input (default: NULL).

title: Encrypt or decrypt single files — lock_file
text: invisible string containing locked/unlocked file path.

title: Encrypt or decrypt single files — lock_file
code: ## Creating Test Files and Keys -----  temp_dir <- tempfile("dir") dir.create(temp_dir)  temp_file <- tempfile(tmpdir = temp_dir)  rsa_keygen(temp_dir) #> ℹ Keys successfully created at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d817a33900.  con <- file(temp_file, "w+") cat("Test", file = temp_file, sep = "\n") list.files(temp_dir) #> [1] "file19d81ec98173" "id_rsa"           "id_rsa.pub"       suppressWarnings(readLines(con)) #> [1] "Test" close(con)  ## Locking Files -----  temp_file |>   lock_file(     public_key = file.path(temp_dir, "id_rsa.pub")   ) #> ℹ Locked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d817a33900/file19d81ec98173.lockr.  temp_file_locked <- paste0(temp_file, ".lockr")  con <- file(temp_file_locked, "rb") list.files(temp_dir) #> [1] "file19d81ec98173.lockr" "id_rsa"                 "id_rsa.pub"             suppressWarnings(readLines(con)) #> [1] "\037\x8b\b"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  #> [2] "\xf5\xb57\a]\x90n\027d{\xfb<\xa4\x93\xebȊ\xa7M.\xabrE\xeb~Y\xe6\x88>\xf6I\xbd`i\xc7\032\xbcY$\xdel\xcb\xc1\xad\xe6\f\xfb\x9fm\xf8\xc8\xc1\xc3x\x8c]\xe6S\xf0\xab2\xcešj\xf1rf>\xa5S\xba\xccB-\xe7\u07be\xd1ȷ\xa8\xad\xe0\xb07\xdbO+\xa6\xc3\002\xa6u\x92\xd6'\xaf|m"                                         #> [3] "\022Ov\xb2/] \xc9|\xff\x9d\xcda\xf3\xb9\023\x9e\x9d;6_\xe7/S\xce\xe1\033\x9a\xa9B\xc1\x8d{v%E\xb4\037\xf3N\xbb\xf4t\x93\xf0|\xf3\xd4\xc97\177\xcb\xdc\xe9џ\xff+L\x80y\xc6S\xb5ç?=\xe7\xd0f\xbc\xd8w \xf0>\x9fD\x8a\x92\xac\x9f\xb2ّ\\A\xc9e\x9eO\xb9a\xe1S\xb7\xfb\xb8W\026\xdf\027\xfdǛk\x8d\xefpn\x90a``ab" #> [4] "!\xa1"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       #> [5] "\026d\xca,\x83\xb2؋S\x8b\x8b3\xf3\xf3\xa0\\\x96\x94ĒD \xfd\017"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              close(con)  ## Unlocking Files -----  temp_file_locked |>   unlock_file(     private_key = file.path(temp_dir, "id_rsa")   ) #> ℹ Unlocked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d817a33900/file19d81ec98173.  list.files(temp_dir) #> [1] "file19d81ec98173" "id_rsa"           "id_rsa.pub"       con <- file(temp_file, "r+") readLines(con) #> [1] "Test" close(con)

what: Generate and write a pair of RSA keys — rsa_keygen
title: Generate and write a pair of RSA keys — rsa_keygen
text: rsa_keygen() generates pair OpenSSL RSA (Rivest-Shamir-Adleman) private public keys.

title: Generate and write a pair of RSA keys — rsa_keygen
Generate and write a pair of RSA keys — rsa_keygen
text: dir (optional) character string specifying directory save generated keys (default: ::("_ssh")) password (optional) character string specifying password protect private key. NULL, private key protected (default: NULL). bits (optional) integer number specifying length RSA key bits (default: 4096).

title: Generate and write a pair of RSA keys — rsa_keygen
text: invisible NULL. function called side effects .

title: Generate and write a pair of RSA keys — rsa_keygen
code: temp_dir <- tempfile("dir") dir.create(temp_dir)  temp_dir |>   rsa_keygen(     password = "test",     bits = 2048   ) #> ℹ Keys successfully created at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d85abb2dd4.  list.files(temp_dir) #> [1] "id_rsa"     "id_rsa.pub"

what: Save and lock a file — save_and_lock
title: Save and lock a file — save_and_lock
text: save_and_lock() saves data frame R object file locks using RSA encryption.

title: Save and lock a file — save_and_lock
code: save_and_lock(   x,   file,   type = "rds",   public_key = here::here("_ssh", "id_rsa.pub"),   ... )

title: Save and lock a file — save_and_lock
text: x R object saved locked. type = "csv", x must data.frame. file character string indicating file path save object . type character string indicating file type save object . Must one "csv" "rds" (default: "rds"). public_key (optional) openssl RSA public key character string specifying public key path. See rsa_keygen() learn create RSA key pair (default: ::("_ssh", "id_rsa.pub")). ... (optional) Additional arguments passed write_csv write_rds.

title: Save and lock a file — save_and_lock
text: invisible string containing locked file path.

title: Save and lock a file — save_and_lock
code: ## Creating Keys and Test Object -----  temp_dir <- tempfile("dir") dir.create(temp_dir)  rsa_keygen(temp_dir) #> ℹ Keys successfully created at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/dir19d851557668.  x <- letters  ## Locking and Saving Objects -----  x |>   save_and_lock(     file = tempfile(),     type = "rds",     public_key = file.path(temp_dir, "id_rsa.pub")   ) #> ℹ Locked file written at /tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/file19d824849281.lockr. #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpjlNzSx/file19d824849281.lockr"

what: Encrypt or Decrypt HTML Files with StatiCrypt — staticrypt
title: Encrypt or Decrypt HTML Files with StatiCrypt — staticrypt
text: staticrypt() offers interface StatiCrypt tool encrypting decrypting HTML files using password.

title: Encrypt or Decrypt HTML Files with StatiCrypt — staticrypt
code: staticrypt(   file,   password,   config = NULL,   directory = file.path(dirname(file), "encrypted"),   decrypt = FALSE,   recursive = FALSE,   remember = 0,   salt = NULL,   share = NULL,   share_remember = FALSE,   template = NULL,   template_button = "DECRYPT",   template_color_primary = "#4CAF50",   template_color_secondary = "#76B852",   template_instructions = "",   template_error = "Bad password!",   template_placeholder = "Password",   template_remember = "Remember me",   template_title = "Protected Page",   template_toggle_hide = "Hide password",   template_toggle_show = "Show password" )

title: Encrypt or Decrypt HTML Files with StatiCrypt — staticrypt
text: file character string indicating path HTML file encrypted decrypted. password character string specifying password use encryption decryption. security, avoid hardcoding passwords scripts. Use askpass() prompt secure input. config character string specifying path configuration file. NULL, defaults .staticrypt.json directory file (default: NULL). directory character string indicating output directory encrypted decrypted file (default: subdirectory named encrypted directory file). Use dirname(file) overwrite file place. decrypt logical flag indicating whether decrypt encrypt file (default: FALSE). recursive logical flag indicating whether process files subdirectories recursively (default: FALSE). remember integer number specifying number days remember password (default: 0, meaning remember). Use FALSE hide "Remember " option generated HTML. salt character string specifying 32-character hexadecimal salt value encryption. NULL, random salt generated (default: NULL). share character string specifying path share password securely (default: NULL, meaning share). share_remember logical flag indicating whether remember shared password (default: FALSE). template character string specifying path custom HTML template file (default: NULL, meaning use default template). template_button character string specifying text submit button template (default: "DECRYPT"). template_color_primary character string specifying template primary color hexadecimal format (default: "#4CAF50"). template_color_secondary character string specifying template secondary color hexadecimal format (default: "#76B852"). template_instructions character string specifying instructions display template (default: ""). template_error character string specifying error message display incorrect passwords (default: "Bad password!"). template_placeholder character string specifying placeholder text password input field (default: "Password"). template_remember character string specifying label "Remember " checkbox template (default: "Remember "). template_title character string specifying title protected page template (default: "Protected Page"). template_toggle_hide character string specifying text "Hide password" toggle template (default: "Hide password"). template_toggle_show character string specifying text "Show password" toggle template (default: "Show password").

title: Encrypt or Decrypt HTML Files with StatiCrypt — staticrypt
text: invisible NULL. functions called side effects .

title: Encrypt or Decrypt HTML Files with StatiCrypt — staticrypt
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   library(askpass)    staticrypt(     file = "path/to/file.html",     password = askpass()   ) } # }

title: lockr (development version)
text: package code refactored improve readability maintainability. save_and_lock() added. function combines saving locking data single step. staticrypt() added. function creates interface Staticrypt tool encrypting HTML files.

title: lockr 0.3.0 (2023-03-20)
text: encryptrpak renamed lockr. encryptr devtoolsare longer import dependence list. encrypt_extdata() decrypt_extdata() superseded removed package. get_private_key(), get_public_key(), get_private_key_path(), get_public_key_path() removed package. Please use openssl reading keys. rsa_keygen() added. function facilitates creation RSA key pairs. lock_file() unlock_file() added. functions allow user encrypt decrypt individual files. lock_dir() unlock_dir() added. functions allow user encrypt decrypt files inside directory.
